p:
In the Malian sample, 296 (50·4%; 95% CI 46·4–54·5) of 587 children were seropositive 4·5 years after vaccination ( figure 1). Additionally, we classified 113 (19·3%, 95% CI 16·1–22·4) children as borderline (antibody concentration <0·5 IU/mL). When we merged positive and borderline strata into a broadly positive category, 409 (69·7%, 95% CI 66·0–73·4; table 2) were seropositive. This proportion presents a substantial drop from the overall number of children who seroconverted (290 [96·7%] of 300 children) 4 weeks after vaccination in data previously reported by others for different samples of the same vaccinee population.
15
